questions.question: What is the structural and functional unit of living organisms?
questions.answer: Cell

questions.question: Which cell structure is present only in plant cells?
questions.answer: Cell wall

questions.question: Cell wall is mainly made up of:
questions.answer: Cellulose

questions.question: Which membrane is selectively permeable?
questions.answer: Plasma membrane

questions.question: Which process requires energy?
questions.answer: Endocytosis

questions.question: Movement of water through selectively permeable membrane is called:
questions.answer: Osmosis

questions.question: When plant cell is kept in hypotonic solution, it becomes:
questions.answer: Turgid

questions.question: Plasmolysis occurs in:
questions.answer: Hypertonic solution

questions.question: Cytoplasm is found between:
questions.answer: Plasma membrane and nucleus

questions.question: Which organelle controls all activities of cell?
questions.answer: Nucleus

questions.question: Genes are located on:
questions.answer: Chromosomes

questions.question: Which organelle is called transport system of cell?
questions.answer: Endoplasmic reticulum

questions.question: Rough ER has which structure on surface?
questions.answer: Ribosomes

questions.question: Golgi complex mainly helps in:
questions.answer: Packing and secretion

questions.question: Which organelle is called suicide bag?
questions.answer: Lysosome

questions.question: Which organelle produces ATP?
questions.answer: Mitochondria

questions.question: Cristae are found in:
questions.answer: Mitochondria

questions.question: Which organelle is absent in RBC?
questions.answer: Mitochondria

questions.question: Which plastid is green in colour?
questions.answer: Chloroplast

questions.question: Photosynthesis occurs in:
questions.answer: Chloroplast

questions.question: Leucoplast is mainly used for:
questions.answer: Food storage

questions.question: Vacuole in plant cell helps in:
questions.answer: Turgidity

questions.question: Which cell has nucleoid region?
questions.answer: Bacterial cell

questions.question: Which cells are eukaryotic?
questions.answer: Plants and animals

questions.question: Which organelle has its own DNA?
questions.answer: Mitochondria and plastids

questions.question: Which pigment gives red colour to tomato?
questions.answer: Lycopene

questions.question: Which pigment gives purple colour?
questions.answer: Anthocyanin

questions.question: Which is packing department of cell?
questions.answer: Golgi complex

questions.question: Which organelle helps in detoxification?
questions.answer: Endoplasmic reticulum

questions.question: Which cell organelle helps in digestion?
questions.answer: Lysosome

questions.question: Which solution shows no net movement of water?
questions.answer: Isotonic

questions.question: Which organelle forms lysosomes?
questions.answer: Golgi complex

questions.question: Which part stores enzymes for digestion?
questions.answer: Lysosome

questions.question: Which cell type has no membrane bound organelles?
questions.answer: Prokaryotic cell

questions.question: Which pigment gives orange colour to carrot?
questions.answer: Carotene

questions.question: Which organelle stores cell sap in plants?
questions.answer: Vacuole

questions.question: Which structure connects nucleus and plasma membrane?
questions.answer: Endoplasmic reticulum

questions.question: Which organelle modifies proteins?
questions.answer: Golgi complex

questions.question: Which organelle provides rigidity to plant cell?
questions.answer: Vacuole

questions.question: Which pigment gives yellow colour?
questions.answer: Xanthophyll

questions.question: Which organelle is chemical factory of cell?
questions.answer: Mitochondria

questions.question: Which organelle helps in protein synthesis?
questions.answer: Ribosome

questions.question: Which organelle stores genetic material?
questions.answer: Nucleus

questions.question: Which structure protects plant cell?
questions.answer: Cell wall

questions.question: Which organelle maintains homeostasis?
questions.answer: Cell membrane

questions.question: Which cell organelle is absent in prokaryotes?
questions.answer: Nucleus

questions.question: Which organelle is responsible for autolysis?
questions.answer: Lysosome

questions.question: Which cell is rectangular and turgid?
questions.answer: Plant cell

questions.question: Which organelle forms secretory vesicles?
questions.answer: Golgi complex

questions.question: Which pigment traps solar energy?
questions.answer: Chlorophyll

questions.question: What is a cell?
questions.answer: Cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of life. All living organisms are made of cells which perform all life processes.

questions.question: Who discovered the cell?
questions.answer: Robert Hooke discovered the cell in 1665 while observing cork under a microscope.

questions.question: What is cell wall?
questions.answer: Cell wall is a rigid outer covering of plant cells. It gives shape, protection and support to the cell.

questions.question: What is plasma membrane?
questions.answer: It is a thin, flexible membrane surrounding the cell. It controls entry and exit of substances.

questions.question: Why plasma membrane is called selectively permeable?
questions.answer: It allows some substances to pass while restricting others, maintaining internal balance of the cell.

questions.question: What is diffusion?
questions.answer: Diffusion is movement of molecules from higher concentration to lower concentration without using energy.

questions.question: What is osmosis?
questions.answer: Osmosis is movement of water through a selectively permeable membrane from dilute to concentrated solution.

questions.question: What is plasmolysis?
questions.answer: Shrinkage of cytoplasm due to loss of water when plant cell is placed in hypertonic solution is plasmolysis.

questions.question: What is cytoplasm?
questions.answer: Cytoplasm is jelly-like fluid inside cell where all cell organelles are present and activities occur.

questions.question: What is nucleus?
questions.answer: Nucleus controls all activities of the cell and contains genetic material in form of chromosomes.

questions.question: What are chromosomes?
questions.answer: Chromosomes are thread-like structures in nucleus that carry genes and control heredity.

questions.question: What are genes?
questions.answer: Genes are small units of heredity that determine characteristics of organisms.

questions.question: What is endoplasmic reticulum?
questions.answer: It is network of membranes that transports materials inside cell and helps in protein and lipid synthesis.

questions.question: What is rough ER?
questions.answer: Rough ER has ribosomes on its surface and helps in protein synthesis.

questions.question: What is smooth ER?
questions.answer: Smooth ER has no ribosomes and helps in lipid synthesis and detoxification of chemicals.

questions.question: What is Golgi apparatus?
questions.answer: Golgi apparatus modifies, packages and transports proteins and lipids to different parts of cell.

questions.question: What are lysosomes?
questions.answer: Lysosomes contain digestive enzymes and destroy waste and worn-out organelles in cell.

questions.question: Why lysosome is called suicide bag?
questions.answer: If cell is damaged, lysosome bursts and digests cell, causing its death.

questions.question: What is mitochondria?
questions.answer: Mitochondria is powerhouse of cell where energy in form of ATP is produced.

questions.question: What are cristae?
questions.answer: Cristae are folds of inner membrane of mitochondria that increase surface area for respiration.

questions.question: What are plastids?
questions.answer: Plastids are organelles found in plant cells that help in food production and storage.

questions.question: What is chloroplast?
questions.answer: Chloroplast contains chlorophyll and helps in photosynthesis to make food.

questions.question: What is leucoplast?
questions.answer: Leucoplast is colorless plastid that stores food like starch and oil.

questions.question: What is chromoplast?
questions.answer: Chromoplast contains pigments that give color to fruits and flowers.

questions.question: What is vacuole?
questions.answer: Vacuole stores cell sap and maintains turgidity in plant cells.

questions.question: Why vacuole is large in plant cell?
questions.answer: It stores water and maintains pressure to keep plant cell rigid.

questions.question: What are ribosomes?
questions.answer: Ribosomes are small particles that help in protein synthesis.

questions.question: What is prokaryotic cell?
questions.answer: Cell without true nucleus and membrane-bound organelles is prokaryotic cell.

questions.question: What is eukaryotic cell?
questions.answer: Cell with true nucleus and membrane-bound organelles is eukaryotic cell.

questions.question: Give example of prokaryotic organism.
questions.answer: Bacteria are examples of prokaryotic organisms.

questions.question: Give example of eukaryotic organism.
questions.answer: Plants and animals are examples of eukaryotic organisms.

questions.question: Why RBC has no nucleus?
questions.answer: To provide more space for haemoglobin to carry oxygen.

questions.question: What is cell sap?
questions.answer: Cell sap is fluid inside vacuole containing sugars, salts and waste.

questions.question: What is isotonic solution?
questions.answer: Solution with same concentration as cell, causing no net water movement.

questions.question: What is hypotonic solution?
questions.answer: Solution with less concentration than cell causing water to enter cell.

questions.question: What is hypertonic solution?
questions.answer: Solution with higher concentration causing water to leave the cell.

questions.question: Why diffusion is important?
questions.answer: It helps in exchange of gases and nutrients in cells.

questions.question: What is active transport?
questions.answer: Movement of substances using energy against concentration gradient.

questions.question: Why mitochondria has double membrane?
questions.answer: To increase surface area for energy production and protection.

questions.question: What is nucleolus?
questions.answer: Part of nucleus that produces ribosomes.

questions.question: Why Golgi is important for secretion?
questions.answer: It packages materials into vesicles for transport outside cell.

questions.question: What is cell organelle?
questions.answer: Specialized structures in cytoplasm performing specific functions.

questions.question: What is nucleoid?
questions.answer: Region in prokaryotic cell containing genetic material without membrane.

questions.question: Why bacteria lack mitochondria?
questions.answer: Respiration occurs in cell membrane, so mitochondria not required.

questions.question: What is tonoplast?
questions.answer: Membrane surrounding vacuole is called tonoplast.

questions.question: How cells maintain shape?
questions.answer: By cell wall and turgor pressure in plant cells.

questions.question: Why nucleus is absent in mature RBC?
questions.answer: To allow more haemoglobin and efficient oxygen transport.

questions.question: What is vesicle?
questions.answer: Small membrane bound sac used for transport of substances.

questions.question: Why chloroplast is double membrane bound?
questions.answer: To protect photosynthetic machinery and regulate transport.

questions.question: Why cell is called basic unit of life?
questions.answer: All life activities are carried out by cells.

questions.question: What is homeostasis in cell?
questions.answer: Maintaining stable internal conditions inside cell.

questions.question: Why plant cells are rigid?
questions.answer: Due to cell wall and large vacuole creating turgor pressure.

questions.question: What is cytoskeleton?
questions.answer: Network of protein fibers maintaining shape and movement of cell.

questions.question: Why ER is continuous with nuclear membrane?
questions.answer: It helps in transport of materials between nucleus and cytoplasm.

questions.question: What is cell division?
questions.answer: Process by which cell divides to form new cells.

questions.question: Why cell division is important?
questions.answer: For growth, repair and reproduction of organisms.

questions.question: What is mitosis?
questions.answer: Division of somatic cells producing identical daughter cells.

questions.question: What is meiosis?
questions.answer: Division forming gametes with half chromosome number.

questions.question: Why chromosomes duplicate before division?
questions.answer: To ensure equal genetic material to daughter cells.

questions.question: What is cell differentiation?
questions.answer: Process by which cells become specialized in function.

questions.question: Why animal cells lack cell wall?
questions.answer: They need flexibility for movement and shape change.

questions.question: What is membrane fluid mosaic model?
questions.answer: Model describing flexible lipid bilayer with embedded proteins.

questions.question: Why ribosomes are found freely and on ER?
questions.answer: Free ribosomes make internal proteins, ER ribosomes make secretory proteins.

questions.question: What is genetic material?
questions.answer: DNA that carries hereditary information.

questions.question: Why cell organelles are important?
questions.answer: They perform specific functions for survival of cell.

questions.question: What is metabolism?
questions.answer: All chemical reactions occurring in cell.

questions.question: Why mitochondria called powerhouse?
questions.answer: It produces energy required for cellular activities.

questions.question: What is transport protein?
questions.answer: Protein that helps substances cross cell membrane.

questions.question: Why cell membrane is flexible?
questions.answer: To allow growth, movement and transport.

questions.question: What is permeability?
questions.answer: Ability of membrane to allow substances to pass.

questions.question: Why chlorophyll is important?
questions.answer: It absorbs sunlight for photosynthesis.

questions.question: What is cell communication?
questions.answer: Process by which cells send and receive signals.

questions.question: Why Golgi has flattened sacs?
questions.answer: To efficiently process and pack proteins.

questions.question: Why mitochondria have their own DNA?
questions.answer: They can make some proteins independently.

questions.question: Why plastids also have DNA?
questions.answer: They evolved from bacteria and can replicate.

questions.question: What is cellular respiration?
questions.answer: Breakdown of food to release energy in cells.

questions.question: Why plants store starch?
questions.answer: As reserve food for future use.

questions.question: Why plant cells have plastids?
questions.answer: For photosynthesis and food storage.

questions.question: Why nucleus is called brain of cell?
questions.answer: It controls growth, metabolism and reproduction.

questions.question: What is cellular organization?
questions.answer: Arrangement of cells to form tissues and organs.

questions.question: How multicellular organisms grow?
questions.answer: By increase in number of cells through division.

questions.question: Why unicellular organisms divide?
questions.answer: For reproduction.

questions.question: Why cells need energy?
questions.answer: For growth, repair and movement.

questions.question: What is enzyme?
questions.answer: Biological catalyst that speeds up reactions.

questions.question: Why enzymes are important in cell?
questions.answer: They control all metabolic activities.

questions.question: What is cell theory?
questions.answer: All living organisms are made of cells and cells arise from pre-existing cells.

questions.question: Who proposed cell theory?
questions.answer: Schleiden and Schwann proposed cell theory.

questions.question: Who added that cells arise from pre-existing cells?
questions.answer: Rudolf Virchow added this statement.

questions.question: Why cell study is important?
questions.answer: To understand structure and function of organisms.

questions.question: What is microscopy?
questions.answer: Study of small objects using microscope.

questions.question: Why microscope is needed?
questions.answer: Cells are too small to be seen by naked eye.

questions.question: What is staining?
questions.answer: Using dyes to make cell parts visible under microscope.

questions.question: Why plant cells have chloroplast?
questions.answer: To prepare food by photosynthesis.

questions.question: Why animal cells do not photosynthesize?
questions.answer: They do not have chloroplast.

questions.question: Why cell membrane is essential?
questions.answer: It protects cell and regulates transport.

questions.question: What is cell specialization?
questions.answer: Different cells perform different functions.

questions.question: What is tissue?
questions.answer: Group of similar cells performing same function.

questions.question: Why cells are called living factories?
questions.answer: They perform all chemical activities needed for life.

questions.question: Why cell study is foundation of biology?
questions.answer: All biological processes start at cellular level.

questions.question: Give conclusion of Cell chapter.
questions.answer: Cell is basic unit of life and its organelles perform vital functions for survival.
